page.title: 05Farming in North Leigh
page.content: In North Leigh there are seven farms. They are called Ashford Mill Farm,Holly Court Farm,Bridewell Farm,Shakenoak farm,Field farm,Perrotts Hill Farm and the Field farm.At farms there are animals which give us food and drink,such as cows which give us milk and pigs which give us meat.Some farms sell eggs, milk and meat.Every morning the farmers have to get up early to feed the animals and to milk the cows.Most of the milk is taken away by lorries. Also the farmers have to grow grass to feed the animals and he has to grow vegetables,wheat,barley and corn.When the corn,wheat and the barley is ready, it is taken to the mills to be turned into flour. Then it is made into bread, cakes,buns and all sorts of things. Helen Mathews and Jennifer Connor
